en: to return something you have bought to a shop
to admit that something you said was wrong

examples: Is it too small? Take it back and get a refund.
All right, I take it all back. It wasn't your fault.

en: to be similar to an older member of your family in appearance or character

examples: He takes after his mother/his mother's side of the family.
Lazy? He takes after his father.
She takes after me with her love of horses.
